ACT
205
Record of declaration of written will
The record of the declaration of a written will should contain:
1. how many wills were found, what date they are and where they were found,
2. who submitted them to the court or death certificate maker,
3. which witnesses were present at the opening and promulgation of the will and how was their identity established,
4. whether the will was submitted open or closed and with what seal it was sealed.
If during the opening of the will it is noticed that the seal is damaged or that something has been deleted, crossed out or corrected in the will, or if anything else is suspicious, this must also be stated in the minutes.
The minutes are signed by the judge, that is, the court advisor, recorder and witnesses.
On the declared will, the court will put a certificate that it was declared with an indication of the date when it was declared and the number and date of other wills found that have already been declared by that court.
